title: Universidad de Los Andes F.C.
text:
Unión Local Andina Fútbol Club, usually known as Universidad de Los Andes, or by the acronym ULA, is a <a href="Venezuela">Venezuela</a>n <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="M%C3%A9rida%2C%20M%C3%A9rida">Mérida</a>.
History.
The club was founded on February 28, 1977, as "Universidad de Los Andes Mérida Fútbol Club".
Copa Libertadores.
Universidad de Los Andes disputed <a href="Copa%20Libertadores%20de%20Am%C3%A9rica">Copa Libertadores de América</a> three times.
In 1984, in the first stage, the club was in the same group of <a href="Portuguesa%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Club">Portuguesa</a>, of Venezuela, and two <a href="Peru">Peru</a>vian teams, <a href="Sporting%20Cristal">Sporting Cristal</a>, and <a href="FBC%20Melgar">Melgar</a>. The club finished in the first position, together with Sporting Cristal. A first place playoff was played, and ULA won 2–1. In the second stage, the club was in the same group of two <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian clubs, <a href="Clube%20de%20Regatas%20do%20Flamengo">Flamengo</a>, and <a href="Gr%C3%AAmio%20Foot-Ball%20Porto%20Alegrense">Grêmio</a>, and was eliminated after finishing in the last position .
In 1992, the club was, in the first stage, in the same group of <a href="Sport%20Club%20Mar%C3%ADtimo%20de%20Venezuela">S.C. Marítimo</a>, of Venezuela, and <a href="Barcelona%20Sporting%20Club">Barcelona</a> and <a href="Valdez%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Club">Valdez</a>, of <a href="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>. ULA and Marítimo finished in the third position, so, a third place playoff was played. Marítimo won 1–0, and Universidad de Los Andes was eliminated .
In 1999, ULA disputed the preliminary stage of the competition, with <a href="Estudiantes%20de%20M%C3%A9rida%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Club">Estudiantes de Mérida</a>, of Venezuela, and <a href="Necaxa">Necaxa</a> and <a href="Club%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Monterrey">Monterrey</a>, of <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The club was eliminated after finishing in the last position .
Stadium.
ULA's home stadium is <a href="Estadio%20Guillermo%20Soto%20Rosa">Estadio Guillermo Soto Rosa</a>, which has a maximum capacity of 15,000 people.
Colors.
The club's colors are blue and white.
